Analysis of Variance

Analysis of Variance

anova(df, keep_data_object = FALSE)

Arguments

df

data frame
keep_data_object

logical to keep objects from aov and TukeyHSD

Examples

data(gw_data)

wells <- c("MW-1", "MW-2", "MW-3", "MW-4")

params <- c("Calcium, dissolved", "Sodium, dissolved", "Sulfate, total")

gw_data %>%
  filter(location_id %in% wells, param_name %in% params) %>%
  anova()
#> # A tibble: 18 x 6
#>            param_name   rowname       diff          lwr         upr
#>                 <chr>     <chr>      <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl>
#>  1  Sodium, dissolved MW-2-MW-1   6.768000   2.86600237  10.6699976
#>  2  Sodium, dissolved MW-3-MW-1  11.373000   7.47100237  15.2749976
#>  3  Sodium, dissolved MW-4-MW-1   4.042444   0.03352298   8.0513659
#>  4  Sodium, dissolved MW-3-MW-2   4.605000   0.70300237   8.5069976
#>  5  Sodium, dissolved MW-4-MW-2  -2.725556  -6.73447702   1.2833659
#>  6  Sodium, dissolved MW-4-MW-3  -7.330556 -11.33947702  -3.3216341
#>  7     Sulfate, total MW-2-MW-1  83.625000  65.51250210 101.7374979
#>  8     Sulfate, total MW-3-MW-1  42.185000  24.07250210  60.2974979
#>  9     Sulfate, total MW-4-MW-1   7.125000 -11.48382261  25.7338226
#> 10     Sulfate, total MW-3-MW-2 -41.440000 -59.55249790 -23.3275021
#> 11     Sulfate, total MW-4-MW-2 -76.500000 -95.10882261 -57.8911774
#> 12     Sulfate, total MW-4-MW-3 -35.060000 -53.66882261 -16.4511774
#> 13 Calcium, dissolved MW-2-MW-1  -5.420000 -20.59164931   9.7516493
#> 14 Calcium, dissolved MW-3-MW-1 -15.045000 -30.21664931   0.1266493
#> 15 Calcium, dissolved MW-4-MW-1  14.813333  -0.77405457  30.4007212
#> 16 Calcium, dissolved MW-3-MW-2  -9.625000 -24.79664931   5.5466493
#> 17 Calcium, dissolved MW-4-MW-2  20.233333   4.64594543  35.8207212
#> 18 Calcium, dissolved MW-4-MW-3  29.858333  14.27094543  45.4457212
#> # ... with 1 more variables: p.adj <dbl>

anova_object <- gw_data %>%
  filter(location_id %in% wells, param_name %in% params) %>%
  anova(., keep_data_object = TRUE)

plot(anova_object$anova[[1]], 1)
